alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:46PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Greene and northern Hale Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 546 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Knoxville, or 13 miles northeast of Eutaw, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moundville, Akron, Elliots Creek, Wateroak, Harper Hill, Moundville Airport, Phipps and Havana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and west central Alabama.
